author: Elizabeth Winkler
title: CBS-Viacom Fight Is Fixed
text:
Media titans don’t like to lose their empires. But if they must, they prefer to do so on their own terms. For Les Moonves, the longtime chairman and CEO of CBS, the possibility of doing so is rapidly dwindling.

He has no interest in merging his company with Viacom, a sentiment apparent in CBS’s lowball bid, which Viacom has—unsurprisingly—rejected. And he seems threatened by the idea of a successor lined up to replace him, as evidenced by CBS’s insistence that any combined entity be run by CBS’s executive team. That wouldn’t...
